summary_md: The Netherlands, in the latest year, has a GDP per capita (51,471 USD per person) and an inflation rate (3.35%). The unemployment rate (3.60%) and life expectancy (81.91 years) are also recorded. Internet usage (97.00%) and export growth (84.13%) are significant indicators of the country's economic environment.

sections.economy_md: The Netherlands' economy is characterized by a high GDP per capita (51,471 USD per person) and a moderate export growth (84.13%).
sections.labor_md: With an unemployment rate (3.60%), the labor market reflects a balance between job availability and workforce participation.
sections.digital_md: Internet usage (97.00%) in the Netherlands is high, indicating a well-connected population.
sections.health_env_md: The life expectancy (81.91 years) in the Netherlands suggests a high standard of living and access to healthcare.

job_seeker: High GDP per capita (51,471 USD per person) may indicate a competitive job market.
Moderate unemployment rate (3.60%) suggests opportunities for employment.
entrepreneur: High GDP per capita (51,471 USD per person) indicates potential for business growth.
Moderate inflation rate (3.35%) could affect business costs.
digital_nomad: High internet usage (97.00%) supports remote work and digital nomad lifestyles.
Moderate export growth (84.13%) suggests a stable economy for digital entrepreneurs.
expat_family: High GDP per capita (51,471 USD per person) and life expectancy (81.91 years) may contribute to a high quality of life for expat families.
Moderate unemployment rate (3.60%) and internet usage (97.00%) indicate a supportive environment for family integration.
